description: Online reference library containing full-text dictionaries, encyclopedias, and other reference books.

name: Gale eBooks (GVRL)
description: Searchable e-books providing quick information on a variety of topics including business, history, countries of the world, science, education, multicultural studies, social science, and more.

name: Gale OneFile Gardening and Horticulture
description: Peer-reviewed, scholarly, and popular resources on gardening, landscape design, horticulture, and related topics, from 1980 to present.

name: Gale OneFile Gender Studies
description: Peer-reviewed, scholarly, and popular resources on gender studies, LGBTQIA+ topics, women's studies, family, and more from 1980 to present.

name: Gale General OneFile
description: Offering more than 14,000 titles including peer-reviewed, scholarly, general interest, and trade publications on an array of topics including science & medicine, business, economics, literature, drama, politics, careers, technology, and more from 1980 to present.

name: Greenfile
description: Access to peer-reviewed, scholarly, governmental and popular resources with information on environmental impacts by corporations, governments, and individuals as well as resources for minimizing those impacts.

name: HarpWeek
description: Contains electronic access to Harper’s Weekly, an illustrated 19th century periodical available here from 1857 - 1865: The Civil War Era. Harper's Weekly offers insight into 19th-century America on a cumulative week-to-week basis with news stories, illustrations, cartoons, editorials, biographies, literature, and even advertisements that shaped and reflected public opinion in this era.

name: Home Furnishings Retailers Database [Chain Store Guide]
description: Covers buyer contacts and basic information on home furnishings retailers such as IKEA, Rooms To Go, Pier 1 Imports, and more. (To be included, retailers must have two units or operate one unit with sales of at least $10 million. Wholesalers and distributors must have sales of at least $1 million.)

name: Gale OneFile Home Improvement
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing from 1984 to present for more than 4.5 million articles from more than 200 construction, architecture, materials, and home improvement focused titles, covering topics including techniques, tool and material selection, zoning requirements, and more.

name: WGSN Interiors
description: Trend reports & forecasting for lifestyles and interiors.

name: New York Times Historical [1851-2020]

name: New York Times (NYTimes.com)
description: Access to nytimes.com website including most of the archive

meta.more_info:
Please click here for full instructions on how to access New York Times Academic Pass: 

  • NEW subscribers to NYT can visit accessnyt.com to create an account (register). They type in the school name and follow the instructions based on their location. If the new subscriber encounters an error message that subscriber can email edu@nytimes.com.
  • EXISTING registered subscribers with ACTIVE PAID subscriptions need to cancel their personal subscription by connecting with a chat agent on the site, or calling 800-698-4637 before creating an account. Once the subscription is canceled, they can visit accessnyt.com, type in the school name and follow the instructions based on their location. Since the subscriber “Already has an account " they click “Log In" (Found below "Create an Account"). Input their email address and the same “Password” created for their previous account. If the subscriber encounters an error message that subscriber can email with edu@nytimes.com.
  • EXISTING registered subscribers that DO NOT HAVE ACTIVE NYT subscription can visit accessnyt.com , type in the name of the school and follow the instructions based on their location. Since the subscriber "Already has an account " they click “Log In" (Found below "Create an Account"). Input their email address and the same “Password” created for their previous account. If the subscriber encounters an error message that subscriber can email edu@nytimes.com.

name: New York Times (Gale)
description: Full-text of the The New York Times from 1985-current. May not contain content exclusive to nytimes.com

name: Gale in Context Opposing Viewpoints
description: Articles, essays, videos, statistics, maps etc. about recent and current social issues.

name: Oxford Art Online
description:
Full text of Grove Art Online
There is a 3-user limit to this database -- please log off when you are finished

Advertising & Branding, Apparel, Textiles & Fashions, Consumer Products & Services, E-Commerce & Internet,Entertainment, Publishing & Media, Games, Apps & Social Media, Green Technology, and Retail. Also some company profiles for "major companies and mid-size firms" in those industries.

PDF versions of industry market research annuals:
Advertising & Branding, Apparel, Textiles & Fashions, Consumer Products & Services, E-Commerce & Internet,Entertainment, Publishing & Media, Games, Apps & Social Media, Green Technology, and Retail. Supplemented and updated by Plunkett Research Online

description: Full text content of hundreds of popular magazines and scholarly journals, 1984- current. Includes images and videos.

Searches 11 Databases at once:

name: Psychology and Behavioral Sciences Collection (EBSCO)
description: Topics include emotional and behavioral characteristics, psychiatry & psychology, mental processes, anthropology, and observational & experimental methods. Full text articles from 400 journals, coverage dating back to the 1940s.

description: Scholarly & general articles, some e-books 1980- present

name: RKMA Market Research Reports
description: Biannual reports on marketing and the consumer behavior. Focuses include entertainment, healthcare, leisure, restaurants, retail, sports, travel and tourism. Coverage dates back to 2011.

name: Salem Press Online
description: Reference e-books including Magill's Literary Annual, Critical Survey of Graphic Novels; american history by decade; Fashion Innovators; Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender Events; Civil Disobedience, Social Justice, Nationalism & Populism, Violent Demonstrations and Race Relations and Nations of the World.

name: Salesman's Guide
description: Buyer contact lists for retailers across North America. Includes Gift, Houseware and Home Textile Buyers, Independent Sales Representatives and Multi-Line Showrooms, and the Retail Buyer Database.

Reports cannot be downloaded

name: Vogue Archive
description: Contains every issue of Vogue from 1892 to present. Each issue can be browsed cover-to-cover in searchable full-text format. Each page and image is reproduced in high-resolution color with indexing, enabling images to be searched by garment type, designer, and brand names, among others. All covers, advertisements, fold outs and pictorial features are captured as separate documents,which are also indexed, searchable, and viewable in high-resolution color.

description: Contains full-text, abstracts, indexing for all articles from the Wall Street Journal from 1984 to present with top news stories and detailed information on the arts, sports, business, and popular culture.

description: Contains full-text from scholarly journals and magazines from 1990 to present for more than 400,000 articles on history for novice historians as well as academic researchers.

name: WorldCat Dissertations (FirstSearch)
description: WorldCat Dissertations is a database of all dissertations and theses listed in WorldCat, a free to use index of a wide variety of resources, and the tools to help find which libraries hold them.

name: Statista
description: A resource for global market and consumer data and statistics.

name: WindowsWear
description: Contains images, 360 degree panoramas, and descriptions of physical and digital window displays in a real-time, searchable database of community-generated content that provides data on what retail environments look like around the world with coverage from 1931 to present.

meta.more_info:
1. Visit ​WindowsWear
2. Click “Join now” on the top right
3. Select "Academic" on the right
4. Under "existing members" select "FIT"
5. Create profile
6. Under "get started" select "student" or "faculty"
7. Use your FIT email and create a password
8. Click "join"
You will need to login to WindowsWear after authenticating via the proxy to use the site.

name: eMarketer
description: Provides data, statistics, insights, and perspectives for marketing in a digital world.

name: Fashion Studies Online: The Videofashion Library
description: Spanning almost 40 years, this collection includes over 1,200 hours of videos of runway shows, designer profiles, and documentary films including coverage of the major fashion weeks in Milan, Paris, New York and London, as well as Miami swim and New York bridal collections.

name: Women's Magazine Archive
description:
Contains an archive starting in 1883 to 2005 for eleven magazines typically marketed to women, with high-resolution color scans and feature detailed article-level indexing. Titles and specific coverage includes:

- Better Homes & Gardens (1922 - 2005)
- Chatelaine (1928 - 2005)
- Cosmopolitan (1926 - 2004)
- Essence (1970 - 2005)
- Good Housekeeping (1885 - 2005)
- Ladies’ Home Journal (1883 - 2005)
- Parents (1926 - 2005)
- Redbook (1903 - 2005)
- Seventeen (1944 - 2005)
- Women’s Day (1937-2005)
- Women’s International Network News (WIN News) (1975-2005)

name: Harper's Bazaar Archive
description:
Harper's Bazaar is the world’s oldest continuously published fashion magazine, with coverage starting in 1867 to present with additional access to the UK edition from 1929-2015, both of which are fully indexed and searchable.

Harper's Bazaar (US): 1867-Current

Harper's Bazaar (UK):
April 1930-Dec 1969

Harpers and Queen (UK):
Jan 1972-Dec 2000

Harper's Bazaar (UK):
Jan 2007-Dec 2007

name: EDITED
description: Real-time access to retail data to make informed product, marketing and pricing decisions.

meta.more_info: To register for an account, the professor of each class using EDITED must provide a list of students' names, email, and graduation year to EDITED, support@edited.com. Please first ask students for permission to share their contact information.

A code will be sent to your email to use to login

For help, please contact BoF at professional.groups@businessoffashion.com.

name: Sophicolor

In the Company field, enter "FIT," and for job title enter "FIT Student" or “FIT Faculty”

You will receive an email from Sophicolor once your account has been approved.

name: SPARC Digital
description: SPARC Digital is a platform created by FIT's Special Collections and College Archives to showcase the rare and unique materials from our collections that have been digitized. Our goal is to make our collections more widely available online to the FIT community and the general public.

name: Slavery in America and the World: History, Culture & Law
description: Legal materials on slavery in the United States and the English-speaking world, including every statute passed by every colony and state on slavery, every federal statute dealing with slavery, and all reported state and federal cases on slavery.

name: Social Sciences Full Text
description: English language journals in the field of social sciences.

name: MEDLine with Full Text
description: Medical journals, full text from 1940s- current, some abstracts & indexing 1800+.

name: Gun Regulation and Legislation in America
description: Covers the subject of gun control and legislation with access to 550 periodicals, key compiled federal legislative histories, relevant congressional hearings, CRS Reports, and Supreme Court briefs. These include the National Firearms Act, the Miller and Heller decisions, and other key aspects.

name: HeinOnline

name: Bloomsbury Fashion Central
description:
Access to:

  • Berg Fashion Library
  • Fashion Photography Archive
  • Fairchild Books Library
  • Bloomsbury Fashion Business Cases

Coverage of world fashion from 1500 BCE to present, including books, scholarly articles, and an extensive image collection including the V&A Museum's fashion collection (1600 images); the Philadelphia Museum of Art (2800 images); the Bath Fashion Museum (970 images); the Commercial Pattern Archive (2200 images); the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute collection (2000 images); and the MoMu Fashion Museum, Belgium (600 images).

meta.more_info: Please use an incognito browser to access this resource.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Britannica Academic Edition
description: Encyclopedia with a searchable and browsable collection of authoritative references, including Britannica's latest articles, hundreds of articles not found in the print Britannica, Merriam-Webster's Collegiate Dictionary (Tenth Edition), the Britannica Book of the Year, and links to non-Britannica sites curated by Britannica editors.

name: Gale OneFile Economics and Theory
description: Covers over twenty million articles, including full text coverage of over 1000 publications from 1980 to present. Contains academic, trade, and scholarly peer-reviewed materials.

name: CHIN (Canadian Heritage Information Network)
description: Open access database covering Canadian art history, archaeology, art conservation, history, museum studies, intellectual property, and the natural sciences, including (among others) Artefacts Canada, Artists in Canada, Canadian Heritage Information Network's Data Dictionaries, and Canadian Heritage Information Network's e-News.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: CINAHL Plus with Full Text
description: Contains articles and abstracts for nursing and allied health journals starting in 1937, providing full text for more than 770 journals indexed in CINAHL.

name: Gale OneFile Communications and Mass Media
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 400 journals on all aspects of the communications field, including advertising, public relations, linguistics, and literature from 1984 to present.

name: Gale OneFile Computer Science
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 600 journals and periodicals, including the computer, telecommunications, and electronics industries from 1967 to present.

name: Costume
description: Full text access to Costume journal from 2000-current.

name: Gale OneFIle Criminal Justice
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 250 periodicals for those studying law, law enforcement, or terrorism, training for paralegal service, preparing for a career in homeland security, delving into forensic science, investigating crime scenes, developing policy, going to court, writing sociological reports, and much more, with coverage from 1981 to present.

name: Coloro Workspace
description: A digital tool to explore and work with all 3,500 colors in the Coloro system, allowing you to play with them in different ways

meta.more_info:
New users must register for a free account: 

  • click signup or login on top yellow banner
  • click Workspace on the top right

name: DOAJ: Directory of Open Access Journals
description: Provides full-text open access journals covering all scientific and scholarly subjects. To be included in the DOAJ, journals must use a funding model that does not charge readers or their institutions for access and must exercise peer-review or editorial quality control.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Gale OneFile Diversity Studies
description: Access to articles that explore cultural differences, contributions and influences in the global community

name: EBSCO Databases: Multiple Databases Search
description: Search across multiple databases and subjects at one time.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: eBooks (FirstSearch)
description: Listings of e-books that are not necessarily available through FIT; check individual listings.

name: ECO: Electronic Collections Online (FirstSearch)
description: Listings of online scholarly articles that are not available in full-text on this database but may be available in full-text from other databases through FIT; check individual listings.

name: Edinburgh University Press
description: Full-text access to the following journal: Costume.

name: Gale OneFile Educator's Reference Complete
description: Provides full text coverage of education periodicals and reports.

name: Fashion Photography Archive
description:
Curated by Valerie Steele, Director of the Museum at FIT in New York, this resource showcases more than 775,000 newly-digitized images that feature forty years of contemporary fashion history. Images range from runway and backstage to street-style fashion, and from key designers’ shows from the last forty years.

Use an incognito browser to access this resource.

name: Fashion History Timeline
description: Open Access resource on fashion history with entries and essays on a wide range of topics such as the fashion of specific periods, garments, films, and artwork.

name: FIT Library YouTube Channel
description: Video tutorials covering FIT Library services, collections, and database access including how-tos for researching specific subjects.

name: Gale OneFile Fine Arts
description: A collection of articles, case studies, transcripts, videos, and images from a range of publications, including peer-reviewed, scholarly, industry-focused, and general audience from 1980 to present.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Gale in Context Middle School
description: For Middle school students. A collection of videos, newspapers, magazines and primary sources on topics of literature, science, social studies, and history.

name: Gale OneFile Business
description: Peer-reviewed, scholarly, popular, and trade publications across business-related topics, including company information, accounting, business theory, economics, management, marketing and more from 1980 to present.

name: Gale OneFile Health and Medicine
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 2,500 periodicals, reference books, pamphlets from 1983 to present. Also contains hundreds of videos demonstrating medical procedures and live surgeries.

name: Gale OneFile Hospitality and Tourism
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing from 1981 to present for more than 17 million articles on the cultural and economic aspects of travel and tourism. Also includes content on state parks and information on planning a vacation to full-text travel guides from Fodor's.

name: Gale OneFile Military and Intelligence
description: Scholarly journals, magazines, and reports covering all aspects of past and present military affairs.

name: Gale OneFile Information Science
description: Covers all aspects of managing and maintaining information and technology.

name: Gale OneFile Insurance and Liability
description: Provides access to information on the protection of assets, physical or intellectual.

name: Gale OneFile Leadership and Management
description: Topics include 21st-century skills, organizational dynamics and leadership, adult learning and continuing education. Full-text articles for over 400 journals, coverage dating back to the 1980s.

name: Gale OneFile Science
description: With access to over 1.6 million items and articles, this resource includes a full range of science information, including peer-reviewed, scholarly, and general interest titles as well as video content from various producers, including Nova and AP News.

name: Gale OneFile Religion and Philosophy
description: Topics cover the impact religion has had on culture throughout history, including literature, arts, and language. Full-text articles from more than 250 journals dating back to the 1980s.

name: Gale OneFile U.S. History
description: Original and curated content on all aspects of U.S History. This includes Gale-created materials along with titles from 120+ notable publishers, thousands of newspapers and journals, and more than 175 million pages of primary sources.

name: Gale OneFile Vocations and Careers
description: Contains full text articles from 1984 to present from more than 300 titles for those researching a vocation, finding an appropriate institution of learning, job searching, and maintaining a career.

name: Gale OneFile War and Terrorism
description: Contains full text from 1970 to present for more than 1.7 million articles from 200 journals for analysts, risk management professionals, and students of military science, history, and social science.

name: Health Source Consumer Edition
description: Contains full-text articles, magazines, and reports from 1984 to present on fitness, nutrition, diabetes, aging, women's health, children's health and more with access to 80 full-text magazines, 110 full-text reference books, more than 18,800 Clinical Reference Systems reports.

name: Health Source Nursing/Academic Edition
description: Contains full-text articles, indexing, and abstracts for more than 250 peer-reviewed journals from 1952 to present focusing on pediatric nursing, critical care, mental health, nursing management, medical law and more.

name: Ingenta Connect
description: Largest resource for access to articles from scholarly publications (some full text)

name: Library, Information Science & Technology Abstracts with Full Text
description: Range of publications covering all aspects of librarianship and information management

name: LinkedIn Learning
description: Access training tutorials via the MyFIT platform.

name: Military and Government Collection
description: Current news from magazines and journals pertaining to all branches of the military.

name: New England Journal of Medicine
description: Full-text articles 1990 - current (indexing and short summaries only for 1812 - 1989).

name: Newspaper Source Plus (EBSCO)
description: Articles and images from US and global English-language newspapers and tv & radio news transcripts, from 1985 - current

name: Milne Open Textbooks
description: A catalog of open textbooks authored and peer-reviewed by SUNY faculty and staff

name: Project Gutenberg
description: Includes classic literature published before 1923. Full-text of over 60,000 ebooks in the public domain.

name: Regional Business News
description: Includes more than 80 regional business newspapers, journals and radio and tv transcripts, covering all metropolitan and rural areas in the United States. Coverage dates back to the 1960s.

name: Taylor and Francis Online
description:
We have full-text access to the following Taylor & Francis publications:

  • Costume (2012-2016; see Edinburgh University Press for 2000-current)
  • Dress
  • Journal of Textile Design, Research and Practice
  • Fashion Practice
  • Fashion Theory
  • Textile

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Tutorials
description: Video tutorials for databases and information literacy topics

name: WorldCat (FirstSearch)
description: Index of a wide variety of resources and the tools to help find which libraries hold them.

name: Academic OneFile
description: General-audience, trade publication and scholarly articles on a wide range of subjects, 1980-current.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: FIT Institutional Repository
description: The FIT Institutional Repository is an open access digital archive designed to collect, preserve, and provide access to the intellectual and creative output of the FIT community (students, faculty and staff). The repository includes the entire collection of the FIT School of Graduate Studies graduate theses, and additional work from students and faculty, including text, image and video-based resources.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Diversity & Ethnic Studies eBook Collection
description: A collection of nearly 5,000 eBooks e-books on the topic of diversity, equity, and inclusion

name: Ethnic Diversity Source
description: Covers the culture, traditions, social treatment and lived experiences of different ethnic groups in America, providing full-text content from peer-reviewed journals, magazines, e-books, biographies, and primary source documents.

name: Jet Magazine Archive
description: Archive of Jet magazine from the first issue in 1951 through 2014, covering art, news, politics and other social topics with an African-American focus. The archive includes over 3,100 issues providing a broad view of culture, fashion and entertainment.

name: Fashion and Race Database
description:
The Fashion and Race Database examines the history and impact of race in the fashion system and our everyday life.

1,600+ research resources (including media) in The Library, covering interdisciplinary topics and categorized by keyword, author and year 

Original essays, profiles and object analyses, primarily authored by racialized and minoritized scholars and writers 
Search content across the platform 
Resources can be collected, saved and emailed with the "My List" feature
Accessibility-compliant for screen readers, low vision, dyslexia, and seizure risk 
"Related Content" on the content pages aids in discovering new and relevant material 
FRD adds and updates content on a monthly basis

meta.more_info:
Visit The Fashion and Race Database to validate as an FIT user
Sign up for an account using an FIT email
After the initial visit verifying FIT access, users are free to come back to FRD by way of any link to fashionandrace.org (proxied link not required)

name: Vogue Business
description:
Our Educational Membership provides access to a Standard Membership, which includes the majority of content and access to all virtual events. 

*Advance Membership articles and Vogue Business Index are not included.*

Please note: Vogue Business often redirects or links to Vogue.com and Vogue Runway which are not part of the FIT Library's subscription.

meta.more_info:
• Users must register for an account using an FIT email address.
  • Students should indicate "student" for the "job title" and "seniority" fields.
  • If you already have a free account you will receive an error message stating your account already exists---please contact Vogue Business directly using the email that displays on the login page
  • Check your FIT email for the verification link and follow those instruction---the link expires in an hour from when it is generated.

name: CB Insights
description: CB Insights is a comprehensive global database of private companies and investors’ activities, including information about private equity, venture capital, and emerging markets. Tools provide users with quantitative data and profiles of investment firms, individual investors, private companies, and valuations, as well as reports and research articles. View any company’s funding, investors, competitors, partners, and more.

meta.more_info:
Users must create an account using an FIT email address. Check your email to click on a link from CB Insights.

Reset your password using this link.

name: SUNY OER Services
description: Ready-to-adopt course catalog, facilitating the seamless integration of  openly-licensed content into learning management systems

name: House Beautiful Archive
description:
The archive of the US edition of House Beautiful, from its first issue in 1896 to the present.

The oldest still-published US shelter magazine, House Beautiful not only records the history of interior design, but demonstrates how broader social and cultural trends – e.g. women’s roles, family life, new technologies, and consumer behavior – have manifested themselves in domestic settings for over 125 years.

name: Artforum Archive
description:
The backfile of Artforum (later Artforum International), the leading magazine for coverage of international contemporary art, from its launch in 1962 to 2020.

Spanning six decades of reporting on art in all media, Artforum offers features, reviews, and interviews relating to artists, exhibitions, publications, and other art world events / trends.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Exploring Race in Society
description: Designed for high school and undergraduate students, Exploring Race in Society provides context and solutions-oriented points of view within a scholarly collection of proprietary and licensed content on topics related to race, ethnicity, diversity and inclusiveness.

name: Center for Art Law
description: Database of articles and art law resources

meta.more_info: Register using the code shared in the URL

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Access World News Research Collection
description: International, national, regional, and local news

name: Fashion Calendar Research Database
description: The Fashion Calendar (1941-2014) was  an independent, weekly periodical that served as the official scheduling clearinghouse for the American fashion industry. This resource, originally published by Ruth Finley, was digitized by FIT as part of digital humanities project in 2021 and is now available online as the Fashion Calendar Research Database. Users can search, map and graph historic events from the fashion and the creative industries.

name: Daily News Record Archive
description:
Coverage from 1917-2008

Features 90+ years of breaking news, expert analysis, and​ imagery chronicling fashion​ market dynamics, design evolution, and business strategies. Standing as one of the longest-running fashion trade titles​ and​ a leading news resource for the fashion industry, this exclusive archive brings a focus on men’s fashion, an area​ largely unrepresented by digital archives until now. Highly influential in the industry, this publication contributed to the​ establishment​ of several early menswear fashion shows

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Material Order
description: Powered by CollectionSpace (LYRASIS) and co-founded by Harvard University Graduate School of Design and Rhode Island School of Design, Material Order is the leading resource for design materials collections at academic and cultural institutions.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Gale LegalForms (NYS)
description:
New York legal forms: 

Official, State Specific, Federal, Business, Personal, Real Estate and General forms covering hundreds of legal subjects and issues

name: Gale Books and Authors
description: Book suggestions fiction, non-fiction, biographies and more. Contains book reviews and reading suggestions but does not contain ebooks.

name: LGBT Magazine Archive
description: Archival runs The Advocate and Gay Times,

name: ProQuest Historical Newspapers: Black Newspaper Collection
description: Provides genealogists, researchers and scholars with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

name: Footwear News Archive
description: An archive of Footwear News, with coverage from its first issue in 1945 to the present. Articles, advertisements, and covers are included, with searchable text and article-level metadata. Footwear News was launched as the first dedicated news periodical of the footwear industry and the archive preserves 75+ years of essential global industry news, analysis, and coverage of seasonal trends.

name: Rolling Stone Archive
description: The backfile of Rolling Stone, from its launch in 1967 to the present. One of the most influential consumer magazines of the 20th-21st centuries, it initially sought to reflect the cultural, social, and political outlook of a generation of students and young adults. It has been a leading vehicle for rock and popular music journalism, as well as covering wider entertainment topics such as film and popular culture. Major journalists and authors to have contributed include Hunter S. Thompson, Patti Smith, and Tom Wolfe.

name: Vibe Archive
description: The full run of Vibe magazine - the US magazine of record for hip-hop culture from 1993-2014. Founded by Quincy Jones, Vibe not only offered influential reporting and news about rap, hip-hop, and R&B music but more broadly represented the associated urban youth culture. It is renowned for its pioneering role in establishing mainstream coverage of this culture and for raising the profile of many major hip-hop and R&B artists.
